metadata.titel_preek: A Gospel For Those Who Are Afraid

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of paralyzing fear (Lack) to a state of peace and 'more than conqueror' status (Object) through the presence and ownership of God (Subject/Sender).

tekstueel_bewijs: Then he spoke, and the storm passed.
Christ is more than a match for our fears.
God does wait to hear and bless his people's deepest needs.
bidding their terrors to be calm
putting at peace their wild, distressed fears
we were born to be worthily possessed
I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine
The gospel is for those who are afraid.
it gives us the status of possessed people.
The gospel gives us a partner
There is a secret place of prayer
the evil of war and the danger of narcotics
a deep marsh of evil and sin, of treachery and betrayal
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Fear is described as a 'venom' and 'poison' that turns the soul into a 'dismal swamp,' requiring divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human act of 'pouring out' fears in prayer to receive healing.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God owns us) enables the secondary program (we can pray).

voorbeelden_god_subject: he spoke, and the storm passed.
God was still sitting King of the floods
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are afraid of our friends.

voorbeelden: religion... drives them with demands they cannot meet
we need a heavenly Father to possess and to keep us
The disciples remembered Jesus was on board.
Christ is more than a match for our fears.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God to overcome the 'Inability' of the fearful human subject. It is a sermon of endowment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Fear) to ~S1 (Adrift) to S1 (Owned by God), explicitly rejecting ~S2 (Exemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in 'Presence' rather than 'Removal' of the contrary (the storm).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; fear is treated as a paralyzing, ontological threat.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the human 'we' is frequently the grammatical subject, the narrative 'engine' is driven by God's ownership and Christ's presence. The hearer is the beneficiary (Receiver) of an action performed by Christ (Subject).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Each of us has available an appointed place where we can sob out our deepest fears

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Primary Actor in Crisis
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the battle is not yours but the Lord's
I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are used as mirrors of human helplessness, not as models of virtue.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and security; shift from self-reliance to reliance on the 'Partner'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic comfort in the face of psychological/existential distress.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three points (Possessed, Place to air, Partner) all reinforce the same actantial structure: God acting for the benefit of the fearful.
spanning_punten: The tension between fear as a 'precious endowment' and fear as a 'venomous poison'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the gospel gives us a partner, a companion to go with us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to the 'Partner' (Christ) rather than an internal Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is a 'deep marsh' but the focus is on the resulting 'fear' rather than 'guilt'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the rescue and the Hearer as the Receiver. It avoids moralism by emphasizing God's ownership over human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase 'Savoir-faire' (Knowledge) of the Cross to ground the 'Pouvoir' (Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'ownership' explicitly to the price paid in the Atonement.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Fear is well-described, but its root in Sin/Separation could be sharper.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Connect the 'fear of life' to the 'fear of judgment'.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To ensure the 'Gospel' isn't just seen as a psychological tool.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God owns us) correctly precedes the 'Ethics' of prayer/trust.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a theocentric sermon that addresses human emotion without falling into the trap of moralistic self-help.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'bayou' imagery; Greimassian analysis shows these images function as 'Helpers' to establish the 'Partner' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Johannine context of the 'I Am'; semiotics focuses on the functional role of Jesus as the one who possesses the 'Pouvoir-faire'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Prayer' in this sermon is not a 'Work' (Subject action) but a 'Place' (Space) where the Receiver meets the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Transmission' (Sender-Receiver) very effectively by framing the Gospel as a gift of 'status' (being owned).
